titles.title: Providing for the disposition of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1358) to require the Secretary of Commerce to convey to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts the National Marine Fisheries Service laboratory located on Emerson Avenue in Gloucester, Massachusetts.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-449, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1358. Upon adoption of this resolution the House shall be considered to have taken from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 1358, with the Senate amendment thereto, and to have concurred in the Senate amendment with an amendment consisting of the text printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 177.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 204 - 167 (Roll No. 11).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 344 - 24 (Roll no. 12).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 1/5/1996--Introduced. Provides for taking from the Speaker's table H.R. 1358 (National Marine Fisheries laboratory conveyance) and agreeing to the Senate amendment with an amendment.
